SEARCH
Package org.boardgames.crossway.model

Class Board

java.lang.Object
org.boardgames.crossway.model.Board
public class Board extends Object
Represents the game board with a fixed square size. This class manages the state of stones placed on the board and provides methods for placement, retrieval, and serialization.

The board uses a Map to store the positions of placed stones, which makes it efficient for sparse board states and lookups. The class is designed to be easily serialized to and deserialized from JSON using the Jackson library.

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board(BoardSize size)
      Constructs a new empty board of a given size.
      Parameters:
      size - The size of the board. Must not be null.

    • Board

      public Board(BoardSize size, List<Move> stones)
      Constructs a new board instance from a list of moves. This constructor is used by the Jackson library for deserialization. It populates the board grid with stones based on the provided moves.
      Parameters:
      size - The size of the board.
      stones - A list of Move objects representing the stones to place.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if a stone is out of the board's bounds.

  • Method Details

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Clears all stones from the board, resetting it to an empty state.

    • swapColors

      public void swapColors()
      Swaps the color of every stone currently on the board.

    • placeStone

      public void placeStone(Point point, Stone stone)
      Places a stone at a specified point on the board.
      Parameters:
      point - The point where the stone will be placed.
      stone - The stone to be placed.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the point is out of the board's bounds.

    • clearCell

      public void clearCell(Point point)
      Clears the stone at the specified point from the board.
      Parameters:
      point - The point whose stone should be removed.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if there is no stone at the specified point.

    • stoneAt

      public Optional<Stone> stoneAt(Point point)
      Retrieves the stone at a specified point on the board.
      Parameters:
      point - The point to check.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the stone if one is present at the point, or an empty Optional if the cell is empty.

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty(Point point)
      Checks whether a point on the board is not occupied by a stone. This also checks if the point is within the board's boundaries.
      Parameters:
      point - The point to check.
      Returns:
      true if the point is within bounds and is empty, false otherwise.

    • isOnBoard

      public boolean isOnBoard(Point point)
      Checks whether the given point is within the bounds of the board.
      Parameters:
      point - The point to check.
      Returns:
      true if the point's coordinates are valid for this board, false otherwise.

    • getSize

      public BoardSize getSize()
      Gets the size of the board.
      Returns:
      The BoardSize object representing the dimensions of the board.

    • getStones

      public List<Move> getStones()
      Gets a list of all stones on the board as a list of moves. This method is used for JSON serialization and returns a sorted list for consistent output.
      Returns:
      A sorted List of Move objects representing the placed stones.

    • toJson

      public String toJson()
      Serializes the current board state into a JSON string.
      Returns:
      A JSON string representing the board.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if serialization fails.

    • fromJson

      public static Board fromJson(String json)
      Deserializes a JSON string into a new Board instance.
      Parameters:
      json - The JSON string to deserialize.
      Returns:
      A new Board instance with the state from the JSON string.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the JSON is invalid or represents an invalid board state.
